Additional apparatus for the Pennsylvania edition of Dreiser's Sister Carrie :
emendations in the copy-text, rejected proof alterations, sample historical collation /
compiled by James L.W. West with the assistance of Ann B. Parsons and James M. Hutchisson.

The Pennsylvania edition of Sister Carrie (Philadelphia :University of Pennsylvania Press, 1981) includes a selected apparatus criticus. The complete apparatus is reproduced here for "deposit at the University of Pennsylvania Library, the Library of Congress, the Lilly Library, and the Huntington Library." Cf. p. ii.

Laurence Olivier (George Hurstwood), Jennifer Jones (Carrie Meeber), Miriam Hopkins (Julie Hurstwood), Eddie Albert (Charles Drouet), Basil Ruysdael (Mr. Fitzgerald), Ray Teal (Allan).

An ambitious country girl living in the slums of Chicago in the 1890's becomes the mistress and eventually the illegal wife of a successful businessman whose love for her causes him to lose his home, job, family, self-respect, and ambition.
Summary quoted from M/B/RS preliminary shelflist card, PREMARC, LCCN Fi52-2205.
Based on the novel Sister Carrie, by Theodore Dreiser.
Source(s) used: 1) M/B/RS preliminary shelflist card, PREMARC, LCCN Fi52-2205 2) Ross & Nash's The motion picture guide, 1927-1983, p. 363-364.
